page.title: 16A DISTRICT NURSE IN APEDALE
page.content: As a State Enrolled District Nurse, living in a rural area, my base is Church Stretton Health Centre, about 9 miles away. I work 37 hours a week, having every Thursday and every other weekend off. I work all Bank Holidays and have 35 days leave annually. Most of my patients are in the older age bracket and welcome the opportunity of a chat. I carry out the same basic nursing duties in the patient's home as I would have done in a hospital. These include Dressings, Baths,Enemas, Catheterizations,Injections,Observatio ns. In addition to these duties, I also have to act as an adviser to the families. Every visit has to be recorded both in the home and at the Centre. A busy but extremely rewarding life,and one full of human interest.
